subject: testing dir structure
msgSnippet: yahoo groups are impossible to search thru, the result sets are horrible...  wasn t able to find anything about this via search, so if this has been beaten to
messageBody:
yahoo groups are impossible to search thru, the result sets are
horrible... wasn't able to find anything about this via search, so if
this has been beaten to death my apologies.

my junit recipies finally made it thru the door, and I'm ready to dig
in and start writing some tests for our app. I'm thinking that
separating test packages from production code is the way for us to go
initially, but wondering what may be a better direction for us.

our web app is served via tomcat, and our dir structure looks like this:

/jsp
/jsp/market
/jsp/market/app1/<jspfiles>
/jsp/market/app2/<jspfiles>
/jsp/meta-inf
/jsp/WEB-INF
/jsp/WEB-INF/classes
/jsp/WEB-INF/classes/com
/jsp/WEB-INF/classes/com/ourapp/<javaservlets>
/jsp/WEB-INF/classes/com/ourapp/area1/<javaservlets>
... <etc>

I'd like to lay a ./test subdir in there, my thought is that it can go
alongside /jsp or inside WEB-INF alongside classes

Looking for, and open to, suggestions or point to existing thread

Mike
